link.synopsis: The boring life of businessman Charles Driggs (Jeff Daniels) suddenly changes when free-spirited Audrey (Melanie Griffith) "kidnaps" him for a weekend trip. They pose as a married couple, attend Audrey's high school reunion and visit her mother. But when Audrey's ex-husband Ray (Ray Liotta) shows up, freshly out of jail, this romantic comedy (smartly directed by Jonathan Demme) takes a turn into thriller territory.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

link.synopsis: Preston Sturges helmed this screwball comedy about Gerry Jeffers (Claudette Colbert), a woman who'll do anything to help her struggling architect spouse, Tom (Joel McCrea), succeed. When she realizes Tom will never strike it rich, Gerry decides to divorce him, wed a wealthy man and finance Tom's projects -- so she heads to Palm Beach, Fla., where she tries to land eccentric billionaire John D. Hackensacker III (Rudy Vallee). Mary Astor costars.
link.title: synopsis
No Time for Love / The Egg and I
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
I Was a Male War Bride
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: Dynamic duo Cheech Marin and Tommy Chong embark on an outrageous road trip of sorts, which finds the pair tearing through Los Angeles, making mayhem in massage parlors, trying to collect unemployment, harassing the rich and taking on the LAPD. On their journey through the city, the stoners encounter Cheech's moocher cousin, a rude hotel receptionist and aliens in this laugh-a-minute comedy. Evelyn Guerrero, Sy Kramer and Betty Kennedy co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Cheech Marin and Friends: Live from South Beach
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
The Nine Lives of Fritz the Cat

link.synopsis: A slacker named Ronnie (David Cross) is unwittingly given his 15 minutes of fame by a producer who discovers him when he's arrested on a reality cop show. After finding fortune, Ronnie embarks on an even greater quest: finding true love. Troy Miller directs this irreverent comedy based on a character from the HBO series "Mr. Show." Bob Odenkirk, Nikki Cox, David Koechner and Brian Posehn co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
Tenacious D in: The Pick of Destiny
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut

link.synopsis: Eager to do their part, a very green batch of civilian volunteers joins the new Citizens on Patrol program headed by Officer Carey Mahoney (Steve Guttenberg). Unfortunately, the underhanded Capt. Harris (G.W. Bailey) is determined to see the project fail ... miserably. This fourth installment of the hit comedy film series stars Bubba Smith, Bob Goldthwait, Tim Kazurinsky and Sharon Stone (in one of her early movie roles).
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
Revenge of the Nerds IV: Nerds in Love
Pittsburgh Pirates 1979 World Series Collector's Edition
Three Men and a Little Lady
The Longshot / They Went That-A-Way & That-A-Way
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition

link.synopsis: In this semi-tart valentine to the uniqueness of New York City, Bill Murray (disguised as a clown), Geena Davis and Randy Quaid concoct the perfect bank robbery plan. The only thing that gets in the way is the city in which they operate: They can't for the life of them make a clean getaway. Philip Bosco, Jason Robards, Stanley Tucci and Phil Hartman co-star in this underrated comedy directed by Murray and Howard Franklin.
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Knew Too Little
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: Comedian Paul Reiser ("Mad About You") teams up with Peter Falk ("Columbo") in a father-and-son comedy that's semi-autobiographical, following Ben (Reiser) and Sam (Falk) Kleinman on an impromptu road trip designed to avert a family crisis. Along the way, they let their differences go and end up having the time of their lives. Reiser claims to have written the role of Sam specifically for Falk, who happens to be his favorite actor.
link.title: synopsis
The Last of the Blonde Bombshells
'Tis Autumn: The Search for Jackie Paris
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?
When Did You Last See Your Father?

link.synopsis: A hapless meter reader (Jon Heder) signs up for a confidence-building course to acquire the self-assurance he needs to win the hand of his dream girl (Jacinda Barrett), but the class turns out to be a bust when it becomes apparent that the teacher (Billy Bob Thornton) has designs on the same woman. Michael Clarke Duncan co-stars in director Todd Phillips's remake of the 1960 British comedy of the same name.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?
Meet the Spartans: Unrated Pit of Death Edition
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th

link.synopsis: When their private high school burns to the ground, a group of teen volleyball players must transfer to their inner-city rivals' campus, forcing the girls to put aside their differences and become a unified team. But the drama between the Madonnas and the Phantoms won't be easy to overcome. Music sensation Ciara, Adrienne Bailon (of the Cheetah Girls) and Laila Ali star in this teen comedy featuring tunes by Outkast, Frankie J. and Lil Rob.
link.title: synopsis
Bring It On: In It to Win It
Bring It On: Fight to the Finish
Bring It On: All or Nothing
From Justin to Kelly: The Tale of Two American Idols
The Cutting Edge: Fire and Ice
Girls Just Want to Have Fun

link.synopsis: The socially inept Solomon brothers (Will Forte and Will Arnett) go on a quest to grant their dying father's last wish to have a grandchild in this quirky comedy. But because their dad home-schooled them in the wilds of the Arctic, the guys have no idea how to relate to women. They give it a good try, though, as they proposition potential mates, look into adoption and surrogacy and engage in their own wacky version of fatherhood training.
link.title: synopsis
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
The Dukes of Hazzard: The Beginning
The Night of the White Pants

link.synopsis: Tired of being duped by cheating husbands pretending to be single, Rylee (René Ashton) decides to get revenge. She has one-night stands with married men, then shows up months later with a baby, demanding money. But her plan goes awry when she accidentally targets a single guy who's thrilled at the idea of fatherhood. Ashton co-wrote the script for this offbeat comedy, which stars Lacey Chabert, Julia Duffy, Brody Hutzler and Rance Howard.
link.title: synopsis
What If God Were the Sun?
Jack and Jill vs. the World
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: Seann William Scott stars as Jeff, an alcoholic 20-something who suffers from ADD, dyslexia and Tourette's syndrome. He can't hold a job, but his over-the-top commitment to multiple 12-step programs wins over Lynn (Gretchen Mol), a woman with problems of her own. As a romance between the two damaged souls blossoms, Jeff's life takes a turn toward normalcy. Tod Harrison Williams directs this comedy that co-stars Jeff Garlin.
link.title: synopsis
How to Go Out on a Date in Queens
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: After losing all its hottest waitresses to new competitor Ta-Ta's Wing Shack -- where the scantily clad wait staff earns bigger tips -- the Shenaniganz staff aims to give Ta-Ta's its just desserts in this sequel to the 2005 comedy.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
Bam Margera Presents: Where the #$&% is Santa?
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: This quirky Cartoon Network comedy chronicles the misadventures of Flapjack, a precocious kid who's flanked by two unlikely sidekicks: a talking whale named Bubbie and a rough-and-tumble pirate named Capt. K'nuckles. The first volume of episodes finds the trio racing a mechanical menace dubbed the "Alpha-Whale," tracking down the world's most valuable candy wrappers and making friends with (gasp!) a monster.
link.title: synopsis
SpongeBob SquarePants: Who Bob What Pants
Cartoon Network Halloween: 9 Creepy Cartoon Capers
SpongeBob SquarePants: To SquarePants or Not to SquarePants
Phineas and Ferb: The Daze of Summer
The Powerpuff Girls: The Complete Series
Shaun the Sheep: Back in the Ba-a-th
Shaun the Sheep: Little Sheep of Horrors
Shaun the Sheep: Sheep on the Loose
Looney Tunes Super Stars: Road Runner / Wile E. Coyote
Jane and the Dragon: A Dragon's Tale
Tom and Jerry: Hijinks and Shrieks
Pokémon Advanced: Vol. 2: Tree's a Crowd
Pokemon Advanced: Vol. 3: A Bite to Remember
Pokemon Advanced: Vol. 4: Stairway to Devon
Clifford's Puppy Days: Practice Makes Perfect
Brum: Stunt Bike Rescue and Other Stories
Brum: Snow Thieves and Other Stories
Shaun the Sheep: Off the Baa!
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 6

title.regular: The Marvelous Misadventures of Flapjack: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: Pretty teen Lola and her high school friends struggle to elude their bewildered parents, pull off daring hookups and sow some seriously wild oats in this coming-of-age comedy for the social media era.
link.title: synopsis
True Confessions of a Hollywood Starlet
Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen

link.synopsis: Live! From New York! It's a star-studded celebration of 25 years of "Saturday Night Live!." A comedy institution, "SNL" has launched the careers of comic greats like Bill Murray, Eddie Murphy and Adam Sandler. Featuring a feast of classic clips, hilarious new comedy (with guests such as Chris Rock and Tom Hanks) and musical performances by The Eurythmics, Al Green and Elvis Costello, this recap is a hilarious look back at the first quarter century.
link.title: synopsis
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Amy Poehler
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Chris Rock
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 3
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Adam Sandler
Saturday Night Live: Live from New York: The First 5 Years
Saturday Night Live: Lost & Found: SNL in the 80's
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dana Carvey
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dan Aykroyd
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Tom Hanks
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Steve Martin
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Molly Shannon
Saturday Night Live: The Best of '06/'07
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Phil Hartman
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Commercial Parodies
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Jimmy Fallon
Saturday Night Live: The Best of John Belushi
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Chris Farley
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Gilda Radner
Saturday Night Live: The Best of David Spade
Saturday Night Live: 25 Years of Music
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Alec Baldwin
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Tracy Morgan
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Saturday TV Funhouse
Saturday Night Live: Weekend Update Thursday
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Mike Myers
SNL: The Best of John Belushi
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Chris Kattan
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Merlin's Shop of Mystical Wonders
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Girl in Gold Boots
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 1
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 2
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Prince of Space
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Overdrawn at the Memory Bank

link.synopsis: Although gritty comedian Denis Leary has starred in countless movies and now co-stars in his own television show called "Rescue Me" on cable's FX network, it's Leary's stand-up comedy that put him on the map. This collection combines two of Leary's most popular live comedy shows, "No Cure for Cancer" and "Lock N' Load," as well as bonus material including the music video for Leary's song "Asshole."
link.title: synopsis
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
Dennis Miller: The HBO Comedy Specials
John Pinette: I Say Nay Nay
Craig Ferguson: A Wee Bit o' Revolution
Lewis Black: Red, White and Screwed
Sam Kinison: Why Did We Laugh?
George Carlin: It's Bad for Ya
Henry Rollins: Live Uncut from NYC
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth

title.regular: Denis Leary: The Complete Denis Leary
title.short: Denis Leary: The Complete Denis Leary

link.synopsis: Obsessive soccer mom Wendy (Missi Pyle) poses as a world-class Italian soccer star in order to coach her daughter's (Emily Osment) team in this heartfelt comedy. But can minivan-driving Wendy keep up the charade long enough to steer the girls to victory at the big tournament? Director Gregory McClatchy's comedy co-stars Cassie Scerbo, Jennifer Sciole, Kristen Wilson, Dan Cortese, Master P and Victoria Jackson.
link.title: synopsis
A Cinderella Story: Once Upon a Song
R.L. Stine's The Haunting Hour: Don't Think About It
Spy Kids: All the Time in the World
Nic and Tristan Go Mega Dega
Hannah Montana: One in a Million

link.synopsis: While waiting out a death sentence in an infamous Central American prison, hard-boiled convict Jack Conrad (retired professional wrestler "Stone Cold" Steve Austin) is surprised to learn he's been bought by a reality show mogul who wants to cast him in his latest project. His assignment? To join nine other convicted murderers on the shores of a deserted island, where they'll fight to the death for the title of sole survivor.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Sorority pledges get revenge on a couple of peeping Toms in this titillating comedy. Forced to spend a weekend in a remote locale in order to become Tri-Eta sorority girls, five college girls capture a father-and-son peeping Tom team. The men play dumb, and one girl takes a fancy to the son, but the others get back at the men using military maneuvers. Stacy Oliver, Kevin Wortman, Kelly Kraegel, Tisha Brown and Nicole Holmes star.
link.title: synopsis
The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington

link.synopsis: Ray (writer-director Woody Allen) is an incompetent crook with big dreams and a low IQ. When he sets up his wife, Frenchy (Golden Globe nominee Tracey Ullman), in a storefront to cover his tunneling operation into a local bank, her baked goods take off, and Ray and company are catapulted from rags to riches. This clever comedy's brilliant ensemble cast includes Hugh Grant, Elaine May and Jon Lovitz.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: He's Just Not That Into You
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?

link.synopsis: The freshly risen undead are ready to party in this horror-comedy that finds two employees of a medical supply company unwittingly releasing several zombies from cylinders in which they've been trapped for years. Soon, the local citizenry is forced to deal with a large-scale zombie epidemic as the nasty, brain-eating creatures go on a rampage -- hungry as ever and eager to make up for lost time! Dan O'Bannon (creator of the Alien franchise) directs.
link.title: synopsis
Return of the Living Dead 4: Necropolis
Return of the Living Dead 5: Rave to the Grave
From a Whisper to a Scream
Blood Feast 2: All U Can Eat
Stephen King's Children of the Corn

title.regular: The Return of the Living Dead
title.short: The Return of the Living Dead

link.synopsis: Mickey Rooney, Ruta Lee, Marla Maples and Gary Coleman star in this madcap holiday comedy, in which an aging Hollywood actress invites her eccentric family to Malibu for Christmas, and everything -- and everybody -- goes haywire. With a son-in-law eager to hunt the only local game for Christmas dinner -- the neighbor's guinea pigs -- this crazy clan decks the halls with outrageous yuletide merriment.
link.title: synopsis
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Five on the Black Hand Side
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?

link.synopsis: A young newlywed couple (Pamela Sue Martin and Tim Matheson) moves into a remote village on an island off the coast of Massachusetts, only to find a secret coven of witches that demand they join their circle ... or suffer the grisly consequences. This psychologically taut thriller co-stars Woody Harrelson, Barbara Billingsley and Jeff Conaway.
link.title: synopsis
From a Whisper to a Scream

link.synopsis: Spandex, clowns, nunchakus, pie fights and other bits of insanity collide in hilarious ways in this stream-of-consciousness sketch-comedy explosion from the folks behind the Brainless Horsemen comedy troupe and the "Belly-Flavored Candy" TV show. The low-budget comedy -- which features the inarguable tagline "a movie for people who will watch this movie" -- stars David Dillehunt, Bryan Kasik, Abrill Macbeth and Bianca Villamar.
link.title: synopsis
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 2
Warts & All: The Films of Danny Plotnick
Glick Doesn't Do Red Carpet: Jiminy Glick at the Independent Spirit Awards
Yucko the Clown: The Damn Show
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

link.synopsis: Bishop Larry D. Trotter combines the church choirs of the Sweet Holy Spirit Full Gospel Baptist Church of Chicago for this rousing concert, packed with soul-stirring music and praiseworthy tunes. The song list includes "Don't Last," "If God Said I Can," "Hold On," "I'll Trust," "Till the End," "Tell the Devil I'm Back" (with reprise), "Bountiful Blessing," "Silent Tears," "I'm Going Up" and "My Worship Is for Real."
link.title: synopsis
Bishop Noel Jones: Welcome to the City
Mississippi Mass Choir: It Remains to Be Seen
The Battle for the Olympia I: 1996
The Canton Spirituals: New Life: Live in Harvey, IL
Harvey Watkins, Jr.: It's in My Heart: Live in Raymond, MS
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Mahalia Jackson: Give God the Glory
Gospel Greats Presents: Praise & Worship Live: Vol. 1
Hezekiah Walker and the Love Fellowship Choir: Absolutely Live!
Bishop Paul S. Morton: Let It Rain
Donald Lawrence and the Tri-City Singers: Bible Stories
Sara Renner and the Elements: The Best So Far
Fernando Ortega: Live in St. Paul
DeWayne Harvey & Unrestrained Praise: Tell It
The Lewis Family Presents: Home Sweet Home with Family and Friends
Al Green: Everything's Gonna Be Alright
The Crabb Family: Number 1 Hits Live
Greater Vision Quartets: Live at NQC
Israel and the New Breed: Alive in South Africa
Gotta Serve Somebody: The Gospel Songs of Bob Dylan
B.B. King & Friends: Night of Blistering Blues

title.regular: Bishop Larry D. Trotter & Sweet Holy Spirit Combined Choirs: Tell the Devil I'm Back
title.short: Bishop Trotter: Tell the Devil I'm Back

link.synopsis: Set to the intoxicating rhythms of Brazilian music and filled with color, food and passion, Penelope Cruz stars in this sexy comedy as Isabella, a chef whose motion sickness drives a wedge between her and her husband, Toninho (Murilo Benicio). After Toninho is unfaithful, Isabella relocates from Brazil to San Francisco, where she starts a successful television cooking show. Soon, Toninho follows Isabella to America to try and win her back.
link.title: synopsis
Kama Sutra: A Tale of Love
Red Shoe Diaries: The Movie: Special Edition
The Other Side of the Bed

link.synopsis: Rosalind Russell dazzles in a tour de force performance as the larger-than-life Mame Dennis, who unexpectedly gains custody of her young nephew Patrick in 1920s New York. As Patrick grows, he learns to live by Auntie Mame's motto: "Life is a banquet, and most poor suckers are starving to death!" Peggy Cass, Coral Browne and Pippa Scott co-star in this exhilarating comedy based on the memoir by Patrick Dennis.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.title: My Sister Eileen / She Wouldn't Say Yes
There's No Business Like Show Business
You Can't Take It with You

link.synopsis: In director Leslie H. Martinson's campy action comedy based on the tongue-in-cheek 1960s TV series, Batman (Adam West) and Robin (Burt Ward) battle sharks, Catwoman (Lee Meriwether), The Joker (Cesar Romero), The Penguin (Burgess Meredith) and The Riddler (Frank Gorshin) on the big screen. Can they keep the bad guys from taking over the world? With a "wham!" and a "pow!" the heroes just might pull it off -- and maintain their secret identities.
link.title: synopsis
Return to the Bat Cave: The Misadventures of Adam and Burt
Batman and Robin: The Serial Collection
Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea
The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming
Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan
Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
Superman IV: The Quest for Peace

link.synopsis: At 46, plucky ex-con Jerri Blank (Amy Sedaris) brushes the prison dust off her synthetic slacks to brave the halls of Flatpoint High, doing her best to survive "adolescence" with support from an unambiguously gay art teacher (Paul Dinello) and his closeted colleague (Stephen Colbert). This Sundance selection is a prequel to the short-lived Comedy Central series (created by Sedaris, Dinello and Colbert) that spawned a cult of devoted fans.
link.title: synopsis
The Best of the Colbert Report
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th

link.synopsis: Chronicling the upscale neuroses of three middle-aged couples, this wry comedy of manners stars Alan Alda (who also writes and directs), Carol Burnett, Sandy Dennis, Len Cariou, Jack Weston and Rita Moreno. The longtime friends take vacations together every season until till one of the men ditches his spouse for a much younger woman (Bess Armstrong), tilting the group dynamics and putting their interrelationships to the test.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: A Season of Hope / Seasons of the Heart
The Very Best of Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons
The Carol Burnett Show: Show Stoppers
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?

link.synopsis: Gary Cooper stars in this double feature that has the handsome actor portraying a painter immersed in a Parisian ménage à trois, and an architect in a forbidden romance that ends in bittersweet tragedy. Packing double entendres galore, the racy comedy Design for Living tells the story of an inseparable threesome living in a Parisian garret. In the ethereal film Peter Ibbetson, a couple torn apart continues their illicit romance in their dreams.
link.title: synopsis
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
Beat the Devil / That Uncertain Feeling
The End of St. Petersburg / Deserter
That Wonderful Urge / Love Is News
The Cheat / Merrily We Go to Hell

link.synopsis: Skewering the gooey romantic comedy formula, this over-the-top spoof from the minds behind the Scary Movie franchise stars Alyson Hannigan (American Pie) as a young woman in love with being in love. But after meeting the man of her dreams -- a dashing Brit (Adam Campbell) -- the hopeless romantic runs across every obstacle in the book, from disapproving parents to scheming best friends determined to put the kibosh on the couple.
link.title: synopsis
Meet the Spartans: Unrated Pit of Death Edition
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human
I Could Never Be Your Woman
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Jon Bon Jovi stars as Frank, a down-on-his-luck lawyer who hatches a scheme to finance a women's ice hockey league with credit cards. But when his plan backfires, Frank finds himself on the wrong side of a lawsuit prosecuted by his girlfriend's jealous ex (Cary Elwes). Can Frank redeem himself by launching a successful defense? This slapstick comedy with slap shots also stars Estella Warren and Nora Dunn.
link.title: synopsis
National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human

link.synopsis: When Nazi soldiers flood the streets of Paris, a young Jewish boy (Alain Cohen) is sent to live in the relative safety of the French countryside with an elderly Catholic woman and her anti-Semitic husband (Michel Simon), who warms to the boy while not knowing of his religion. Acclaimed director Claude Berri makes his feature film debut with this semiautobiographical story, laced with comedy and tragedy, that is based on his wartime experiences.
link.title: synopsis
2 or 3 Things I Know About Her

link.synopsis: After falling in love in the early 1950s, Lt. Lionel Hardcastle (Geoffrey Palmer) and nurse Jean Pargetter (Judi Dench) part ways when he's sent to Korea and move on with their lives after his attempts to contact her go unanswered. When budding author Lionel searches for a secretary 38 years later, he unknowingly calls the agency Jean owns. After an awkward reintroduction, they resume their romantic relationship in this BBC comedy.
link.title: synopsis
As Time Goes By: You Must Remember This
As Time Goes By: Reunion Specials
Are You Being Served? Again: The Complete Series
Keeping Up Appearances: Life Lessons from Onslow
To the Manor Born: Silver Wedding Anniversary
The Vicar of Dibley: A Holy Wholly Happy Ending
A Bit of Fry and Laurie

link.synopsis: Obliged to enter pre-marital counseling before their church will let them get hitched, happily naïve Bob and Cheryl (Bryan Callen and Alexie Gilmore) begin sessions with their new mentors, Dick and Nora Stelmack (Matt Servitto and Jane Lynch) -- a wildly dysfunctional couple devoted to driving each other crazy. Will getting a taste of real married life scare Bob and Cheryl away from the altar? Steve Blair directs this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
Sex and the City: The Movie

link.synopsis: An ad salesman, Dan, must take a junior position after a corporate shakedown. Worse, he now reports to a much younger boss, Carter -- a mandate made more difficult when Carter becomes smitten with Dan's daughter.
link.title: synopsis
Win a Date with Tad Hamilton!
He's Just Not That Into You
Carlos Mencia: Not for the Easily Offended: Live in San Jose

link.synopsis: In the tradition of cult hits Porky's and American Pie, this outrageous teen sex comedy follows a ragtag band of Hong Kong highschoolers who join the tennis team just to get close to a group of gorgeous Japanese exchange students. With a bet on the line as to which of them can lose his virginity first, the motley crew pulls out all the stops to bed the foreign beauties. Directed by Hero Lip, this ribald tale stars Sammuel Leung and Jimmy Wong.
link.title: synopsis
How Tasty Was My Little Frenchman
Balzac and the Little Chinese Seamstress

link.synopsis: Inspired funnymen Harry Shearer, Michael McKean and Fred Willard star in this collection of comic sketches that parodies a TV news team as it hustles to cover the aftermath of the Big One -- an earthquake that has California cracking up and sliding into the sea. Combining fake commercials with faux disaster reportage, the film showcases the talents of comedy troupes the Credibility Gap and Ace Trucking Company.
link.title: synopsis
Dark Star: Hyperdrive Edition: Theatrical Cut
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different
The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes' Smarter Brother
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Suppose They Gave a War and Nobody Came?
Beyond the Valley of the Dolls

link.synopsis: In spite of an intense desire to leave police work forever, Detective Inspector Henry Crabbe (Richard Griffiths) finds himself continually pulled in to help solve crimes even after leaving the force to open his dream restaurant, Pie in the Sky. It seems that Assistant Chief Constable Freddie Fisher (Malcolm Sinclair) can't manage without Crabbe's brainpower -- and refuses to grant him full retirement. Maggie Steed co-stars in this BBC comedy-drama.
link.title: synopsis
Mr. Palfrey of Westminster: The Complete Series
Two Fat Ladies: The Complete Collection
Midsomer Murders: The Great and the Good
Murder Most English: The Complete Series
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Death on the Nile

link.synopsis: Four performers commit death-defying acts of spontaneous humor on this sketch-comedy game show in which host Drew Carey proposes skit and song ideas, and a quartet of improv comedians act them out for randomly bestowed points. Based on the hit British series, the program features setups such as a telethon for thumb-suckers, songs about exterminators and wedding night aboard the &NFi;Titanic,&NFi_; with contestants including Greg Proops and Wayne Brady.
link.title: synopsis
The Carol Burnett Show: Show Stoppers
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Adam Sandler
The Best of the Colbert Report
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Steve Martin
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Mike Myers
Spin City: Michael J. Fox: His All-Time Favorites: Vol. 2

Best of the Chris Rock Show: Vol. 1
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 1
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Molly Shannon
The Best of So Graham Norton
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Christopher Walken

link.synopsis: With an eye to the past and the future, this documentary shines a light on the archetypal American amusement park of Coney Island. Lingering over images of the park's pre-World War II glory days, the film also speculates on what the future may hold.
link.title: synopsis
Wounded Heart: Pine Ridge and the Sioux
Slavery and the Making of America
Empires: Peter and Paul and the Christian Revolution
BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Land of the Eagle
National Geographic: Beyond the Movie: The New World: Nightmare in Jamestown
Friends of God: A Road Trip with Alexandra Pelosi
The Untold Story of Emmett Louis Till
White Light, Black Rain: The Destruction of Hiroshima and Nagasaki
Expo: Magic of the White City
National Geographic: Guns, Germs and Steel
Legendary Sin Cities: Paris, Berlin and Shanghai
National Geographic: Is it Real? Da Vinci's Code
Crips and Bloods: Made in America
American Experience: The Summer of Love
Decoding the Past: Secrets of Kabbalah
Imaginary Witness: Hollywood and the Holocaust
Desperate Crossing: The Untold Story of the Mayflower
When the Levees Broke: A Requiem in Four Acts
American Experience: Jonestown: The Life and Death of Peoples Temple

link.synopsis: In this grisly chiller from British horror maven Pete Walker, Jack Jones plays American pop star Nick Cooper, who retreats to an isolated English estate to write songs and get his groove back. But the appearance of his estranged wife's ghost (Holly Palance) dashes the crooner's plans. Unbeknownst to Cooper, his ex was hacked to death in their penthouse apartment shortly after he departed -- and her spirit is determined to lead him to her killer.
link.title: synopsis
Lucio Fulci: The House by the Cemetery

link.synopsis: Beautiful blonde Kim Novak stars as lusty 18th-century damsel Moll Flanders, Daniel Defoe's ambitious literary heroine whose various romantic entanglements allow her to rise above her humble station. Rollicking and ribald, director Terence Young's sprawling comedy co-stars Richard Johnson (who would later become Novak's husband) as a dashing highwayman with whom the wanton wench finally finds true love.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This delightful screwball comedy follows American schoolteacher Jean Harper (Evelyn Keyes) as she wearies of the bus tour she is taking in Mexico. Upon meeting attorney Jimmy Donovan (Dennis O'Keefe), Jean abandons the bus to follow him, which causes nothing but trouble for Jimmy. As they travel to Acapulco, the couple fall in love and are adopted by a young Mexican boy, but their journey is complicated when Jimmy is accused of kidnapping Jean.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: When a 19-year-old Brazilian photocopier need to come up with some money to impress the girl of his dreams, he hits on a brilliant idea: counterfeiting cash on the copy machine. But his plan soon becomes a habit that spins out of control.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in Rio
The Year My Parents Went on Vacation
The Other Side of the Street
How Much Do You Love Me?
I'm a Cyborg, but That's Ok

link.synopsis: Students take the law into their own hands in this television comedy that follows Jared "Coop" Cooper and the members of Banting High School's Teen Court through the trials and tribulations of growing up.
link.title: synopsis
Bob the Builder: On Site: Skyscrapers
Sid the Science Kid: The Ruler of Thumb
Elmo and Friends: The Letter Quest and Other Magical Tales
Barney: Once Upon a Dino Tale
The Land Before Time: Magical Discoveries
LeapFrog: Math Adventure to the Moon
LeapFrog: The Amazing Alphabet Amusement Park
Mama Mirabelle's Home Movies: Its Movie Time!
Thomas & Friends: Thomas and the Really Brave Engines
Bob the Builder: Scoop's Favorite Adventures
Bob the Builder: Roley's Favorite Adventures
Thomas & Friends: Thomas and the Jet Engine
The Magic School Bus: Bugs, Bugs, Bugs!
The Magic School Bus: Super Sports Fun
Dora the Explorer: Big Sister Dora
Blue's Clues: Blue's Room: Alphabet Power
VeggieTales: The Wonderful World of Auto-tainment
Bob the Builder: Bob's Favorite Adventures
Bob the Builder: Celebrate with Bob

link.synopsis: In Christopher Livingston's screwball comedy, painfully untalented writer Alex (Michael Parducci) has always dreamed of writing a successful movie script. When his uncle in Hollywood finally gives him a shot, the macho, inexperienced Alex teams up with gay Jewish playwright Elliot (Peter Jacobson), and the hilariously mismatched pair attempts to write a hit action film about a New York cop working undercover as a fashion model.
link.title: synopsis
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Surge of Power: The Stuff of Heroes
Eating Out: All You Can Eat

link.synopsis: No serious sports fan could possibly take a sport played with brooms seriously, so this comedy about curling is prime Leslie Nielsen material. Four guys in Long Bay, Ontario, are reunited after the death of their curling coach. To honor their coach's last wish, they proceed to reunite the team and make a go at the greatest prize in the sport: The Golden Broom. Paul Gross co-wrote, directed and stars in this quirky comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
The Boys and Girl from County Clare

link.synopsis: Ewan McGregor stars in this grimly comic tale of three roommates who find their enigmatic new flatmate dead in his room with a stash of drugs and a suitcase full of cash. What will they do with all that money -- and the corpse? Things get even more twisted as drug dealers and the cops start snooping around. Directed by Danny Boyle, this pitch-perfect dark comedy also stars Christopher Eccleston, Kerry Fox and Ken Stott.
link.title: synopsis
Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me

link.synopsis: The lives of several strange characters intersect in John Herzfeld's quirky crime comedy. A depressed has-been director (Paul Mazursky), an arrogant art dealer and his long-suffering assistant, a loser hit man (Danny Aiello), a cold assassin (James Spader) and his girlfriend (Charlize Theron), all with several cops (Keith Carradine, Eric Stoltz and Jeff Daniels) in their pursuit, get tangled up in a murderous insurance scam.
link.title: synopsis
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: Filmed live at the Beacon Theatre in New York in 2000, Ellen DeGeneres makes her long-anticipated return to stand-up comedy. Riffing on everything from filming your sex life to what to do when you forget someone's name, Ellen brings down the house. This Emmy-nominated special showcases the uproarious outlook of one of Hollywood's most outspoken women, as she delivers each hilarious observation in her innocent trademark style.
link.title: synopsis
The Ellen Show: The Complete Series
I'm the One That I Want
Whoopi: Back on Broadway: The 20th Anniversary
Rita Rudner: Live from Las Vegas
Dana Carvey: Squatting Monkeys Tell No Lies
Sam Kinison: Why Did We Laugh?
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 2: On the Edge
Guy Torry's Phat Comedy Tuesdays: Vol. 2
Sex and the City: The Movie
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 3: Launching Pad
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from Dallas

link.synopsis: Eddie Murphy stars as Pluto Nash in this sci-fi comedy -- set in 2087 -- about an audacious moon-based nightclub owner struggling to prevent the Mafia from taking over his digs. With the help of a young singer (Rosario Dawson) and his robot sidekick (Randy Quaid), Nash defies the mob ... and has some rip-roaring zero-g adventures.
link.title: synopsis
The Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
Martian Successor Nadesico: The Motion Picture: Prince of Darkness
The Shape of Things to Come
Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country

link.synopsis: These animated vegetables have lots of lessons to teach kids in this episode from the "VeggieTales" series, in which Larry the Cucumber envisions an automated world where robotic kids sing songs. The comedy of the future, however, makes no sense!
link.title: synopsis
VeggieTales: Sheerluck Holmes and the Golden Ruler
VeggieTales: Lessons from the Sock Drawer
VeggieTales: Bible Heroes: Lions, Shepherds and Queens
VeggieTales: Abe and the Amazing Promise
VeggieTales: LarryBoy and the Bad Apple
VeggieTales: Tomato Sawyer & Huckleberry Larry's Big River Rescue
VeggieTales: The Wonderful Wizard of Ha's
VeggieTales: Duke and the Great Pie War

VeggieTales: Bible Heroes: Stand Up! Stand Tall! Stand Strong!

VeggieTales: Dave and the Giant Pickle

VeggieTales Classics: Rack, Shack and Benny
VeggieTales: The Ultimate Silly Song Countdown
Pirates Who Don't Do Anything: A VeggieTales Movie
Clifford's Puppy Days: Practice Makes Perfect
Fraggle Rock: Live by the Rule of the Rock

title.regular: VeggieTales: The Wonderful World of Auto-tainment

link.synopsis: Charming Lizzie McGuire and her pals Gordo, Kate and Ethan go on the ultimate Roman holiday in this Disney comedy. While there, Lizzie's mistaken for pop music icon Isabella and is soon transformed into a star.
link.title: synopsis
Hannah Montana: One in a Million
All Grown Up!: R.V. Having Fun Yet?
All Grown Up!: Growing Up Changes Everything
As Told by Ginger: Far from Home
All Grown Up!: All Grown Up ... and Loving It!
Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules

link.synopsis: Alec Guinness portrays eight different members of the D'Ascoyne clan, a wealthy family that is being bumped off one by one as a disowned scion, Louis (Dennis Price), murders each heir in his way of inheriting the bloodline's dukedom and fortune. Guinness is mesmerizing in this black comedy as he disappears into each various role -- young and old, male and female. Valerie Hobson and Joan Greenwood co-star as Louis's divergent love interests.
link.title: synopsis
The Ealing Comedy Collection: Whisky Galore
The Man in the White Suit
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: It's a Gift
King and Country / Angels One Five
The Golden Years of British Comedy
Never Give a Sucker an Even Break
The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp

link.synopsis: In this family comedy based on the legendary children's book, 6-year-old Eloise is an imperious but likable rich kid who lives in New York's Plaza Hotel with her nanny while her parents are away. And it's all Nanny can do to keep her under control.
link.title: synopsis
Angelina Ballerina: The Magic of Dance
The Berenstain Bears: Bears Team Up!
The Land Before Time: Through the Eyes of a Spiketail
Angelina Ballerina: The Shining Star Trophy
Angelina Ballerina: The Show Must Go On: Christmas in Mouseland
Blue's Clues: Blue Takes You to School

link.synopsis: This irreverent animated comedy from producer James L. Brooks takes viewers into the world of acerbic New York film critic Jay Sherman (voiced by Jon Lovitz). Pudgy and balding, Sherman is the host of Channel 67's "Coming Attractions," most of which fall far short of his very high standards. The curmudgeonly critic is constantly trying to balance his distaste for popular films with his desire for success and approval.
link.title: synopsis
The Critic: The Complete Series: Disc 1
The Critic: The Complete Series: Disc 2
The Critic: The Complete Series: Disc 3
Dr. Katz: Professional Therapist: The Complete Series
Andy Richter Controls the Universe: The Complete Series
Futurama: Monster Robot Maniac Fun Collection
God, the Devil & Bob: The Complete Series
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 1
A Bit of Fry and Laurie
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Eric Idle's Personal Best
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Adam Sandler
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dana Carvey
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 2

link.synopsis: At the uppity Cherryvale Academy for Women, Christine Ramsay (Phoebe Cates) and her archrival, Jordan Leigh-Jenson (Betsy Russell), set their sights on the same clueless hunk (Matthew Modine), a student at nearby Freemount Academy for Men. Comedy reigns supreme as the two babes wrangle over their man. Meanwhile, a trio of academy boys, desperate for a glimpse of female flesh, will stop at nothing to catch the Cherryvale girls in the buff.
link.title: synopsis
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion

link.synopsis: Based on Novala Takemoto's best-selling Japanese novel Shimotsuma Story, this colorful live-action comedy from writer-director Tetsuya Nakashima tells a tale of unlikely friendship between rough-and-tumble biker chick Ichigo (Anna Tsuchiya) and refined Momoko (Kyoko Fukada). When they meet, Momoko's life is forever changed. But can a big-city girl who adores 18th century France, frilly dresses and parasols save her new friend from certain doom?
link.title: synopsis
Death Note: L: Change the WorLd
It's Kind of a Funny Story
The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
Empire Records: Remix! Special Fan Edition

link.synopsis: For four years, Margit (Myrna Loy) has planned every move of her sister Irene (Florence Rice) and Irene's fiancé (John Beal) and has big things in store for their wedding. But Margit's well-ordered life falls apart with the appearance of freewheeling Charlie Lodge (William Powell). Polar opposites, Margit and Charlie clash over Irene's impending nuptials. Famed screen team Loy and Powell pair for the seventh time in this lighthearted comedy.
link.title: synopsis
That Wonderful Urge / Love Is News
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind
I Was a Male War Bride
Wings in the Dark / Big Brown Eyes

link.synopsis: To grant an old woman's dying wish, Zach (Kristopher Turner) agrees to look for her granddaughter, Heather, who lives deep in the woods. Zach's buddy Ben (Oliver James) and Heather's British cousin, Nigel (Rik Young), tag along, expecting a simple road trip. But none of them is ready for the wilderness ahead -- including a haunted river, drunk townspeople and a band of angry squirrels -- in this outrageous comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Dukes of Hazzard: The Beginning
Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow
The Night of the White Pants
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector

link.synopsis: Fed up with their fruitless attempts to lose weight, Herzl (Itzik Cohen) and his three heavyset friends decide to give up their tortuous diets and try their luck in the girth-friendly arena of sumo wrestling. Led by Japan native Kitano (Togo Igawa), Herzl and crew discover that there are places in the world where oversized waistlines are appreciated. Dvir Benedek and Shmulik Cohen also star in this lighthearted comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Turn Left at the End of the World

link.synopsis: This murderous comedy pits Sweet Stephen's (Callum Blue) sociopathic behaviors and his conscience, personified in Mr. Jack (Matthew Modine), against the determination of a local cop (Adam Baldwin) hot on their heels. Mr. Jack and Sweet Stephen are buddies in the true sense of the word. They spend quality time together on the streets of Los Angeles talking deep philosophy about life, love and death while women literally fall dead at their feet.
link.title: synopsis
Comedians of Comedy: Live at the Troubadour
A Complete History of My Sexual Failures
It's Kind of a Funny Story
Across the Line: The Exodus of Charlie Wright

link.synopsis: Comprised of shorts that skewer medical shows such as "House," this biting comedy follows the misadventures of clown makeup-wearing Dr. Blake Downs (Rob Corddry) and other docs at a pediatric hospital where no one in his or her right mind would ever take a kid. Including episodes from the original Web series and new content, this inaugural season finds  Dr. Cat Black (Lake Bell) seeking romance and Dr. Lola Spratt (Erinn Hayes) faking a tumor.
link.title: synopsis
Andy Richter Controls the Universe: The Complete Series
Tim & Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!
Dr. Katz: Professional Therapist: The Complete Series
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
The Funny World of Lucy: Vol. 2
Futurama: The Beast with a Billion Backs
The Red Green Story: We're All in this Together
Robot Chicken Star Wars: Episode II
The Best of Comedy Central Presents

link.synopsis: Larger-than-life funnyman John Pinette is still hungry for laughs in this sold-out comedy concert filmed live inside Chicago's historic Vic Theater. The crowd eats up Pinette's humor as he questions the sense of panini makers and arugula.
link.title: synopsis
John Pinette: I Say Nay Nay
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Working Class Comics
Michael Jackson: The Life of an Icon
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick

link.synopsis: Anne Bancroft shines as eccentric divorcée Estelle Rolfe in this whimsical comedy from director Sidney Lumet. When she learns she has inoperable cancer, Estelle has just one wish -- to meet the famously reclusive Greta Garbo -- and it's up to her son (Ron Silver) to fulfill it. Along the way, they encounter a number of colorful characters, from an aging Shakespearean actress (Hermione Gingold) to a gay Garbo buff (Harvey Fierstein).
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: To Be or Not To Be
Black White + Gray: A Portrait of Sam Wagstaff and Robert Mapplethorpe
Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work

link.synopsis: Spooky spoofery is the name of the game in this mystery-comedy that pairs Don Knotts and Tim Conway (who also co-wrote the screenplay) as inept investigators Winship and Dr. Tart, who investigate a wealthy couple's murder in their gothic mansion. Between the beautiful but grieving heiress (Trisha Noble), the nutty staff and some ghastly ghosts, the pair finds themselves caught up in one conundrum after another.
link.title: synopsis
The Longshot / They Went That-A-Way & That-A-Way
The Shakiest Gun in the West / The Love God?: Double Feature
Dorf Da Bingo King / Dorf and the First Games of Mt. Olympus
Charlie Chan and the Curse of the Dragon Queen
The Return of the Pink Panther

link.synopsis: This hairy double feature pairs the classic 1980s comedies about two teenage cousins who share an unusual genetic quirk: they're werewolves. In Teen Wolf, Scott Howard (Michael J. Fox) goes from average adolescent to Mr. Popular -- and star of the school basketball team -- when he discovers his lupine roots. Teen Wolf Too stars Jason Bateman as Todd Howard, a college student on a boxing scholarship who turns into a real animal in the ring.
link.title: synopsis
Back to the Future Part III
My Best Friend Is a Vampire
Back to the Future Part II
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension

link.synopsis: This delightful 1960s comedy stars Peter Sellers as the Rev. John Smallwood, an unconventional prison chaplain who's mistakenly appointed as Vicar of the wealthy parrish of Orbiston Parva, known for its local laxative factory. When Smallwood bucks the town's rigid expectations and insists on ministering to the rich and poor alike, he unwittingly shakes up the town's social order and infuriates everyone -- from the needy to the greedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit
The Return of the Pink Panther
What Did You Do in the War, Daddy?

link.synopsis: Before Maria (Theresa Russell) can break the news that she's leaving him for another guy (James Russo), her husband, Alex (Mark Harmon), dies in an accident. But her hopes for new love are shattered when Alex's body disappears from the morgue and begins to appear to her in disturbing visions. Wracked with guilt, she returns to her Catholic roots for guidance. Will Patton and Talia Shire co-star in director Nicolas Roeg's thought-provoking drama.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Escaping a killer, Evelyn (Tracy Scoggins) runs to Blake (Cliff De Young), an ex-hit man, for protection. As Blake tries to resist her wiles, Evelyn seduces him with claims of love -- until he discovers that the femme fatale is the mastermind of deadly plot. Caught in a volatile forgery scheme, Blake also finds himself entangled in Evelyn's perverted love triangle. Henry Darrow and Steven Keats also star in this heated tale of lust and betrayal.
link.title: synopsis
Forbidden Photos of a Lady Above Suspicion

link.synopsis: Jimmy O'Brien (Robert Lowery) and Sammy Rubin (Sidney Miller) are a pair of radio jingle writers who aspire to compose something more sophisticated than commercials. When Jimmy meets Mary (Dona Drake), a talented caf singer, he pretends to be a real songwriter, and they record a demo. A series of wacky misunderstandings leads to an arrest, a lawsuit ... and, ultimately, a happy ending in this musical comedy of errors.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: This slapstick comedy stars Danny Kaye in a memorable role, and features his classic, tongue-twisting "poison pellet" routine. When the infant King of England is deposed by a wicked pretender, the rebel Black Fox (Edward Ashley) devises a plan to reclaim the throne. To set things right, the man charged with tending to the king (Kaye) wriggles his way into the castle by impersonating a court jester -- with zany results. Angela Lansbury co-stars.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Shakiest Gun in the West / The Love God?: Double Feature
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
Thirty Day Princess / Kiss and Make Up
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 4
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 3
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood

link.synopsis: The two new night managers (Henry Winkler and Michael Keaton) at the city morgue decide to make a few extra bucks on the side -- by running a call-girl ring from the same location. Business is booming, but the guys get into trouble when two mobsters want to take a cut. Ron Howard strikes comedy gold with his first A-movie directing job, in the process making an overnight sensation of Michael Keaton.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.synopsis: Sports writer Mike (Gregory Peck) and fashion designer Marilla (Lauren Bacall) meet while traveling, fall in love and quickly get married. But the honeymoon comes to an abrupt end when they return to New York and must contend with the fact that they're practically strangers. Having to deal with exes and angry mobsters only complicates things further. This nuanced comedy, directed by Vincente Minelli, earned an Oscar for Best Original Screenplay.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the Gray Flannel Suit
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
No Time for Love / The Egg and I
I Was a Male War Bride
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
He's Just Not That Into You
Sex and the City: The Movie

link.synopsis: Louis Malle's coming-of-age comedy set in 1950s France follows 14-year-old Laurent (Benoit Ferreux), who's dying to lose his virginity, but is watched closely by his tight family and suffocated by domestic problems, including his mother's marital discontent. When an illness sends him to a spa, he finally finds an opportunity for sex -- with a shockingly unexpected partner. Malle gently confronts taboo subject matter in this Oscar-nominated film.
link.title: synopsis
The Documentaries of Louis Malle: Phantom India
The Documentaries of Louis Malle: Calcutta
The Documentaries of Louis Malle: Vive Le Tour / Humain, Trop Humain / Place de la Republique
Lakki: The Boy Who Could Fly

link.synopsis: Nora Ephron helmed this zany comedy about dysfunctional people, the yuletide and a serial killer at large. Steve Martin stars as Philip, who runs a suicide-prevention hotline staffed by tetchy Mrs. Munchnik (Madeline Kahn) and lovesick Catherine (Rita Wilson). After getting an eviction order on Christmas Eve, the counselors think they've hit bottom -- till they cross paths with an array of wackos, including a psycho St. Nick (Anthony LaPaglia).
link.title: synopsis
A Colbert Christmas: The Greatest Gift of All
Empire Records: Remix! Special Fan Edition

link.synopsis: One morning, California wakes up to find that one-third of its population -- the Hispanic third -- has disappeared in this unusual comedy. The economic, political and social implications of this disaster threaten California's way of life.
link.title: synopsis
Border War: The Battle Over Illegal Immigration
The Bronze Screen: 100 Years of the Latino Image in Hollywood
Paul Rodriguez's Latin All-Stars of Comedy: Vol. 1
Tenacious D in: The Pick of Destiny

link.synopsis: Chantal Stacy (Sandra Dee) is a beautiful socialite with a game plan. She marries photographer Eugene Wright (Bobby Darin) and vigorously sets in motion a training schedule designed to make him the picture-perfect husband -- a sort of comical Stepford Wives in reverse. Stefanie Powers, John Lund and Cesar Romero co-star in this willowy comedy that will remind you of the kind of 1960s featherweight fluff that starred Doris Day and Rock Hudson.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Tammy Tell Me True / Tammy and the Doctor
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life / Who Was That Lady?
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: After climbing into a random window, a Swiss soldier fighting for the Serbian army begs a young and impressionable Bulgarian girl (Helena Bonham Carter) to hide him. In doing so, she's forced to re-examine the values she holds most dear. Subtitled as "An Anti-Romantic Comedy" by the playwright himself, this classic work of George Bernard Shaw uses the conventions of the genre to poke fun at patriotism, war and hero-worship.
link.title: synopsis
The Millionairess / Talking Heads: Bed Among the Lentils
The Rainbow / The Widowing of Mrs. Holroyd
Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain

link.synopsis: In this campy comedy, a group of stoners inhales more than they bargained for when they buy a vintage bong named EeBee from an ad in High Times magazine. They have no idea that the possessed pipe will slowly suck them into a horrifying surreal world. As the potheads fight for their lives, EeBee's former owner (Tommy Chong) -- the only person who understands the bong's power -- tries to rescue them.
link.title: synopsis
The Nine Lives of Fritz the Cat
The Gingerdead Man 2: The Passion of the Crust
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
Revenge of the Nerds III: The Next Generation

link.synopsis: Kevin Covais -- the bespectacled teenage crooner who earned the nickname "Chicken Little" on the fifth season of "American Idol" -- makes his big-screen debut as a prospective college student in this comedy helmed by first-time director Deb Hagen. When three high school seniors (Covais, Drake Bell and Andrew Caldwell) visit the campus of a local university, they embark on an outlandish weekend full of parties, booze, sex and shenanigans.
link.title: synopsis
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile

link.synopsis: Deciding to get married isn't as easy as sweethearts Tony (Joey McIntyre) and Tina (Mila Kunis) imagined in this irreverent comedy based on the long-running play by the same name. First, they deal with the hostility between Tina's mother (Priscilla Lopez) and Tony's father (John Fiore), who dated when they were young. Then they face unexpected problems from an uncooperative priest, a prima donna wedding singer and Tina's ex, Michael (Adrian Grenier).
link.title: synopsis
New Kids on the Block: Coming Home
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Dublin gangster Perrier (Brendan Gleeson) orders his henchmen to collect a debt from small-time crook Michael (Cillian Murphy). But when Michael's unstable pal, Brenda (Jodie Whittaker), accidentally shoots one of the goons during the shakedown, the freaked-out couple must go on the run. Complications mount when Michael's estranged dad, Jim (Jim Broadbent), comes along for the ride in this twisty crime comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Pusher 2: With Blood on My Hands

link.synopsis: At a visiting swami's lecture, Edwardian gentleman Fisk (Jeremy Northam) meets his district's strange new clergyman, Dean Spanley (Sam Neill). The dean is a firm believer in reincarnation, which he expounds upon freely when drinking a particular Hungarian wine. Curious, Fisk delivers a case of the stuff to the dean, regaling in the man's stories about his previous life as a dog. Peter O'Toole co-stars in this offbeat British comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Favor, the Watch and the Very Big Fish
Genius Within: The Inner Life of Glenn Gould
The Man in the White Suit
Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives

link.synopsis: After mining his dysfunctional family and crazy life stories for comic gold on his eponymous hit television series, funnyman Christopher Titus trains his crosshairs on love in this tour-de-force laughfest first broadcast on Comedy Central. Displaying his characteristically edgy brand of humor, Titus muses on the myriad woes of dating, romance, marriage and his rancorous divorce.
link.title: synopsis
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored

Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air

link.synopsis: Over the course of the 20th century, three generations of a family face tumultuous personal and political events as their lives unfold in the Sicilian town of Bagheria -- referred to as Baarìa by many locals. Acclaimed writer-director Guiseppe Tornatore (Cinema Paradiso, Malena) based his intimate comedy epic on his own experiences growing up in this village. Francesco Scianna, Margaret Madè, Raoul Bova, Laura Chiatti and Monica Bellucci co-star in this Golden Globe nominee.
link.title: synopsis
Paul VI: The Pope in the Tempest

link.synopsis: After a lovely evening, Gabriel (Michael Cohen) offers his new acquaintance, Émilie (Julie Gayet), a goodnight kiss. As much as she'd like to indulge, Émilie declines and recounts the story of Nicolas (Emmanuel Mouret) and Judith (Virginie Ledoyen), best friends whose innocent smooch ended in disaster. Written and directed by Mouret, this charming romantic comedy set in Nantes, France, reflects on the consequences and complexities of love.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
The Other Side of the Bed

link.synopsis: Debra Messing stars in this comedy miniseries as Molly Kagan, the jilted ex-wife of a selfish Hollywood studio head who, after her divorce, finds herself blacklisted from the life she once led.
link.title: synopsis
The Best of Comedy Central Presents
The Secret Life of the American Teenager
Family Guy Presents: Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story

link.synopsis: Unable to shake the feeling that everyone at his Seventh Day Adventist summer camp is wrong, teenager Ken (Noah Taylor) gets into trouble by asking sacrilegious questions and eyeing a preacher's alluring daughter. Years later, his Adventist-flavored belief that the apocalypse is at hand propels him to flee the city with his reluctant girlfriend, much to the chagrin of her father. Bob Ellis directs this semiautobiographical coming-of-age comedy.
link.title: synopsis
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
How Much Do You Love Me?
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

link.synopsis: Half loopy parody, half action-comedy, this Bruce Willis vehicle puts its star in the shoes of Hudson Hawk, a skilled cat burglar who times his robberies by singing show tunes. After being released from jail, Hawk wants to do nothing more than hang out in cafés, but criminal financiers Darwin and Minerva Mayflower (Richard E. Grant and Sandra Bernhard) blackmail Hawk into one last job -- stealing a Leonardo Da Vinci device that turns lead into gold.
link.title: synopsis
Harry and Walter Go to New York
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
Harley Davidson and the Marlboro Man

link.synopsis: Arguably the standard bearer for the teen sex comedies of the early 1980s, The Last American Virgin relates the sexual misadventures of Gary (Lawrence Monoson), a hapless pizza-delivery guy hoping to "lose it" to some deserving young lady. Before that happens, we get a Devo soundtrack, a locker-room "penis" contest, weird exchange students, crabs, a fat-kid schlemiel and Diane Franklin as the "nice new girl in town."
link.title: synopsis
The Dangerous Lives of Altar Boys

link.synopsis: David Lee Miller's bizarrely funny comedy stars Vic Dunlop as Walter Clydepepper, a plump and impish pizza deliveryman who dreams of stardom as a stand-up comic. Fame comes in the form of breakfast -- or, rather, a strange, tiny, otherworldly creature that Walter finds in his cereal and ingests. Soon after, an edgy sensibility overcomes his approach to performance, and he makes it big. But soon, Walter learns the monstrous price of success.
link.title: synopsis
The Beast with a Million Eyes
The Award Winners of Hollywood Scarefest 2005

link.synopsis: A high-ranking official loses the respect of the community in Ousmane Sembene's comedy. Set in a newly independent Senegal, the story centers on influential official El Hadji, who decides to take advantage of the rampant corruption by using government funds to marry his third wife. But on his wedding night, El Hadji discovers he has &NFi;xala&NFi_;, the curse of impotence. With his virility in question, he tries a number of ridiculous and bizarre cures.
link.title: synopsis
Love and Other Four Letter Words
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie

link.synopsis: Join outrageous stand-up performer Pablo Francisco for some sharp comedy in this live concert. After appearing as a regular on "Mad TV" and hosting his own Comedy Central special, Francisco gained a worldwide cult following. Here, he apples his biting wit to skewer everything from movies and music to celebrities. Bonus features include "Pablo's Crib," "Meet Pablo's Parents" and "Pablo in Iceland."

link.synopsis: The star of movies like Undercover Brother and Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo and the hit TV show "Malcolm and Eddie," comedian Eddie Griffin gets back into his comfort zone on the stage in this live Comedy Central stand-up special filmed in Oakland, Calif. Named by Comedy Central as one of the top 100 comedians of all time, Griffin riffs on race, politics and pop culture -- and literally takes a journey up the theater walls.

link.synopsis: Canadian heartthrob Corey Hart appears in this collection of videos for the first 16 hits he recorded for Aquarius Records. The clips capture the solo artist's musical development from his 1983 debut hit "Sunglasses at Night" through 1990. Other highlights include 1985's one-two punch "Boy in the Box" and "Never Surrender," "Eurasian Eyes," "Too Good 2 Be Enough," "Angry Young Man" and "Take My Heart."

link.synopsis: Behind-the-scenes footage from the making of controversial "American Idol" contestant Corey Clark's self-titled first album brings the viewer up-close and personal in this exciting documentary. A weekly showstopper during his tenure on the hit reality show, Clark received a rare standing ovation from the regular judges and unanimous praise from various guest judges. The album features Clark performing an eclectic mix of pop, funk and R&B.
